title: Writing Center Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Submit application materials via email. Group interview with other writing center tutors, most other graduate students. They take turns asking questions about writing style, why the writing center, writing strengths, etc.
Interview Questions: How would you correct this writing sample?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: Ok it was nice and what you would have expected from a company like this. Take a look at all the work we have done over the years. It was super nice .
Interview Questions: How are you doing today

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: You submit an application. There was no interview when I got hired. From there you get documents you fill out to be officially hired for the statistics department. The website says I need more words so here they are.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: Went well. I had a 30 min. video interview and was offered the position within twenty-four hours. I was happy to accept the offer and begin my new career and Northern Illinois University.
Interview Questions: Typing skills Personal interaction Software skillset

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with the head of the department. Offering of the several GA-ships. Submit your background in the major, degree, and why you would want to be a GA in this department.
Interview Questions: What is your availability for the semester?

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: very quick interview. checked my soft skills and hardware skills. Then asked me questions about certain aspects of the company and tech support. I was told about job description also
Interview Questions: what is your favorite color

title: GTA Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple.Basic interview where they get to know our experience and how you can manage your work and study being a student.They will decently ask your class schedule.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: easy and fast, focusing on knowldge of research mehodes and theories. don't be prepared, just talk and tell what come to mind. but have some topic that you are interested in to be discussed in the context of research
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself was very easy and everyone has a lot of info to share. Questions they ask are easy to answer and interview was with 4 individuals from the university.
Interview Questions:
previous job requirments
any office experience

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple interview process. Asked basic interview questions such as strengths, weaknesses, things I can bring to the position, etc. The interviewer was very polite and allowed me to feel comfortable throughout the interview. They allow time for you to answer questions at the end.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
What are your experiences in the field?

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: was a simple process including face to face and remote interviews which all were very welcoming also there was some technical challenges that were expected and were relatively simple, cheers.
Interview Questions: Why do u want the job

title: IT Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Basic and informal interview panel with three senior members of the college. Open dialog and welcoming atmosphere. Quick decision and offer, limited room for negotiation. Overall pleasant and informative interview process.
Interview Questions: Over all describe work experience.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: Met with internship supervisor, had 30 minute interview. She asked about my goals for the internship and what kind of project I would like take on. It was a very friendly, fairly informal, interview but still gave each of us a great deal of information.
Interview Questions: What project would you like to complete?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: it was mainly about personal skills, management skills, how to deal with people in different situations. How to handle people, how to conduct surveys and collect appropriate data. how to plot data and analyze from it and such data related questions
Interview Questions: describe yourself

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions:
No technical questions were asked
Questions asked related to your previous work experience
Only behavioral questions were asked
It was quite easy and quick
The interview wouldn't be more than 30 minutes
The questions will be asked based on the department which you applied for
Make sure you know the basics
Interview Questions: Team work

title: Part Time Helper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview process: A phone screen followed by a phone interview with the hiring manager followed by an on site interview. All three took place over the coarse of a few days as they were looking to hire.
Interview Questions: They mostly asked about relevent experiance from resume

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very low key and very friendly.  They followed a script but often went off into finding out more about my skills and how they would fit in the department.  I wanted to work with this team and I knew we would work well together.
Interview Questions: What was one thing about my past job that I didn't like doing?

title: Community Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was intense at first when they asked about jobs and responsibilities but go better in the second half of the interview process. It did not take very long for them to let me know if I got the position or not.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a Community Advisor

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Being a student i received a mail that i was selected. Later I was asked to respond via email and a date was set to complete further fundamental procedures.
There was a 1-1 interview which is basically a conversation on the number of courses and semesters I was available for.
Interview Questions: Regarding the number of courses I was left with

title: IT Technical Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed for 2 IT Technical Associate positions at NIU. One word to describe the process "UNPROFESSIONAL". They conduct one personal interview after passing the civil services examination. It is pretty straight forward and a personality based discussion, nothing technical. 

They do not spend time to know us personally nor get to know our skills and work experience. Most of all, they do not respond to your emails at all. I faced this same reaction from them twice for both of the positions I interviewed for.  

The time from application submission to getting shortlisted for interview is around 20 days, and from the date of interview to getting know the position is filled on their website takes around 50+ days. They do not reply to emails seeking request for updates, and do not show the courtesy to at least email that the positions are filled.  This after they specially ask us to email them for any updates.

If you are an International student Graduating top of your class, recommendations from professors, supervisors and excellent work experience would not get you a job here.  

My recommendation do not waste your time by applying and waiting for them to get back to you for 3-4 months.
Interview Questions: Personality assessment based questions, like how we react to situations?

title: Building Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: After you apply you will be contacted to take a test, if you score high enough you will then be contacted for an interview. You will be interviewed by up to 4 people, some are from H.R and some are building services managers. You will be asked what your availability is and questions like “describe your routine when cleaning a room”. After you leave the interview you may be contacted either the same day or the next day with a job offer if considered for the position.
Interview Questions: Describe your routine when cleaning a room.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: It was an in-person interview with the course instructor where he/she checks the performance of the candidate in the related field of the described course before employing. The questions were generally related to the specif course which was CAD/CAM in my case.
Interview Questions: Explain in brief your previous related work experience?

title: Marketing Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I cam in an interviewed with the director who was very thorough about explaining everything to me and assuring I understood what my role would consist of.  They asked me to talk about how I could contribute to the company and what made my skillset so useful.
Interview Questions: Do you like pineapples on your pizza

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Students wanting to join as a GA for Operations management and information systems department are required to take a SAP terp10 exam which will be help during mid may
Interview Questions: SAP TERP 10 Exam questions

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: Applied to professors who are researching on the same field, and they give you problems to solve, lab experiments and if they like, they offer Assistantship. This varies from prof to prof.
Interview Questions: Perform the Clipping Clamping circuit and show me the results?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: There is nothing like interview.Just got based on academic GPA.Professor reviewed my skills and asked questions based on that topics.As my background is computer science just got it as it's fits the position very well.
Interview Questions: What is your GPA?

title: Structural Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Got a call back after filling the online form within 24hrs, the interview was right after a few paperwork. As at the time I went in for my interview the supervisor was in a meeting, so I was attended to by her assistant.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 yrs

title: Housing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied to the position through an online portal. Got an email a few days later to set up an in person interview. During the interview was asked a variety of questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a stressful situation and how you handled it.

title: Community Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: Check for availability through your class schedule. Standard interview question. How do you work in teams and you organization. You meet with the Residence hall, Hall Director or the Graduate Hall Director for your interview. Just one interview and usually let you know right away if you got the job. Having other roles on campus helps. Be involved.
Interview Questions: How do you organize yourself?

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The position was not formally advertised, and a colleague forwarded me an informal email looking for qualified teaching candidates. There was no formal interview process, other than emailing a letter and CV to the department chair.  We conducted a conference call and I had an email offer shortly afterward. This likely differs from one department to the next. Contingent, teaching-track faculty are seen as disposable, so they apparently did not spend much time on the interview process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at NIU?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: They check if our knowledge is in alignment with their requirements and if we could help the students ease with the course. Matching the skill set in an important phase in here.
Interview Questions: What are the best practices for being a teaching assistant?

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed, simple interview questions, want to get to know you.  They did ask quite a few questions but most were very easy.  There were 3 people during the interview and all of them asked questions and took notes
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an orientation leader

title: Dining Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview during Winter break because I was not living on campus at the time. The questions were pretty standard. It felt like the interviewer was just writing down my  responses instead of actually listening.
Interview Questions: What leadership experience do you have?

title: Residence Hall Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty straight-forward interview. Basically was asking why you wanted to work in said position; asked if you felt you would be able to balance your class schedule with your work hours, etc. It didn't feel as much as an interview as it was an overview of what the job entailed.
Interview Questions: How will you balance your school hours with this job?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
first resume tetsing
then phone call
Then 2 rounds of technical
then the interview was intensely focused on technical knowledge
also the questions were deep down to the computer hardware & networking stuff
also knowledge of system administration
windows server management
printer management
os deployments
Interview Questions: what is sccm & novell

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The process was intense.
You should have a thorough knowledge of things they have as a requirement.
My interview was 2 hrs of technical interview .
Just be truthful & answer confidently.
Know hyper v , server management , project management , SPCC , windows server management , printers knowledge etc
Interview Questions: All technical IT infrastructure questions

title: SILD Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: I met with my boss and her boss at the same time. There was only one interview to get the position. They were both really friendly. They asked about personal work preferences and availability. They also asked about previous work experience and how that would transfer over. The entire interview took about 30 minutes to complete.
Interview Questions: What would you want from your boss if you began working here

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview will go all over the skills on web development. Technology that will be used here will be depending on .Net framework. You should be familiar with technologies belonging to Microsoft like SQL Server, ASP.Net web forms application, ASP MVC etc.
Interview Questions: How do make alerts in web page?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The technical and service skills were tested through a series of questions and finally I was selected and got an offer letter. The questions were about how to troubleshoot a system, installing programs and operating lab equipment.
Interview Questions: Knowledge of Microsoft office? Know to operate a printer? Knowledge of operating a projector?

title: SI Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a beautiful afternoon and they called me that I would have an interview that week. I set the appointment and they let me wait for about half an hour and ask me a few questions. After all that, I was lead to a room where many eyes looking at me and I felt confident coz I dressed the best. All in all, the interview is brief and I will reveal question in the following.
Interview Questions: What do you know about this position and what experience did you have to help us?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call informing me about the interview. It was a face-to-face interview. I was interviewed by two people - the director of the department and the student head.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Huskies Den Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: This was for a promotion and raise. Met with HSC director and my current manager, spoke about my previous years working for NIU. He then decided whether to offer me raise. Very laid back interview. Asked some questions about my strengths and weaknesses, how I've contributed to the business over the years, etc.
Interview Questions: How have you helped generate more traffic?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief introduction and few questions related to my research and field of interest. I was also made to give a presentation before some students and panel members. questions were asked based on the presentation as well as the topics. Few suggestion were given on the presentation and finally they congratulated me and asked about my on going project and tats it.
Interview Questions: Explain about the relation of six sigma with lean.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
wrote an exam picked up resume from the list of students who passed anonymously
face to face interview asked few questions about background and got selected. I gopt graduated and left the job but i loved my job till the end. I would love to work in a place like NIU
Interview Questions: skills suitable with the role

title: Assistant Property Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (Naples, FL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied to an online ad from Craig's list. I submitted my resume and answered their questions. A couple days later they phoned and asked if I was interested in an interview. Interviewed in person with the assistant manager. I thought I answered their questions well. I thought I asked good questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job.

title: Audio/Visual Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview. Look nice, well mannered, and smile. Show confidence. The director of the building is very nice. The interview will be in a private office. Be there on time and be open to directions.
Interview Questions:
What is your past work experience?
How have you solved problems in your last workplace?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
Tell me about yourself aka elevator speech.

title: Office Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Civil Service is an odd category-- candidates must first submit their application to Human Resources who then parse their experience and education to see what categories the candidate is qualified to test for.  
Then testing is completed on campus, with a time limit.  
Candidates are given a score, and put on the 'register'.  
Once on the register, candidates must express interest for any position they would like to be considered for.  
The top names, ranked by testing score, are given to the department.  
The department then conducts interviews and chooses between candidates.
Interview Questions: Typical background and experience questions.

title: Helpdesk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL)
Interview Descriptions: You are interviewed with one to two mangers asked a verity of questions. Sometimes it is done by The manger and asst. manger but there are times the the next level up of mangers will be there. Then depending when you have your interview it could take a few weeks to find out if you got the job that will start next semester. So it is not a job that you should try to get if you need a job right away.
Interview Questions: What computer experience with computers do you have

title: Graduate Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. You will be interviewed by the top 3 people one-on-one and decisions are made very quickly. Be prepared for a very long interview and its possible they ask more questions even after you have asked them yours.
Interview Questions: Mostly behavioural questions, tell us about how you prioritise, examples of previous teamwork experience

title: Office Support Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Human Resources is very tough and sometimes unnecessarily unreasonable or unfair. Not the greatest experiences coming through the door. The interview with the department I applied for was pleasant.
Interview Questions: How to handle a suddenly heavy workload.

title: Career Success Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews, very long wait times on everything.  Interviewed with search committee and then those that interact with the position, and then department chair.  Was brought back for another interview with department and search chairs.
Interview Questions: Very standard academic interview questions starting with walk me through your resume.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: No Interview for Graduate Assistant positions. In lieu of this, you must an application (separate from your application to the Graduate School) to the University to be considered for an assistantship. Then, your employment as a graduate assistant depends upon your academic progress in your respective graduate program of study.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: At the start you go and ask for GA application process, then you will find that there is no one to tell you about any job openings or other positions. If you are lucky you might get a chance to apply for 1 or 2 positions. Most of the applications are not reviewed properly, Jobs are only given to those with recommendations. If there are few applicants with influential recommendations, they get an interview call. Selection is still a mystery.To be precise its a lucky draw system( you never know when you will be fortunate)
Interview Questions: First they will ask for Basic MS office or Database or Designing experience. And then ask questions on them.

title: IT Technical Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two quick interviews, met with panels of 3 interviewers.  questions were concise and lightly technical.  very few follow up questions from the answers given.  I received a call back within 24 hours, then met with HR a week later, then received a paper offer, then a week to accept and get started
Interview Questions: All questions were related to the field I was interviewing form

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: First, all the applicants apply to the program, then those that meet the standards are brought in for a mass interview. It's typically a one day mass interview where all the candidates get together and meet with the professors in a round-robin (or speed dating) process. Following that, the professors select who they think will do the most work for them.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was the only one that applied, and he was hesitant to hire me as I'm not very good at these things. Luckily my skill set was more than adequate to meet the needs of the university. Still working for them and I probably will for the foreseeable future until I can land a good full time job.
Interview Questions: About my programming experience

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't much of one for me.  I got the job through my professional network and they were really desperate at the time because of contract limitations and budget issues.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews for the position after you get accepted into a specific program. The first interview is part of GSARP. This is a large group interview to see your strengths and interests along with the other people that are vying for the positions. The second is an individual interview with the offices that you select that you would be interested in working for.
Interview Questions: Goals in the field, Interest in the office, prior experience in the office, what projects related to this in undergrad?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: To be considered for the interview there were many factors for this position. Firstly I was required to have taken the course, I should have excelled the course, compete with other classmates who were eligible for this position. Luckily, I had less competition since I was the only student who had aced the course and was available to work without any limitation.
Interview Questions: How do I think I am the perfect fir for this position?

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: One in person interview. They ask behavioral questions and questions about your resume. Study some behavioral questions so you are prepared. Pretty straight forward and the best advice would to be honest and let them know what you are looking for.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you dealt with adversity.

title: IT Technical Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Illinois University
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process can take a long time since every applicant has to be ranked due to civil service guidelines. Don't be surprised to hear nothing for 2 months, receive an interview, and then hear nothing for another 2 months. You will probably interview with 2 to 4 people. There is a lot of pride in the university so they are looking for eager hires.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Single quick interview than straight to work the next week. Amanda was extremely nice and easy to talk to during the interview. I would have no fear going in. Enjoy the gig. Its an amazing one.
Interview Questions: What are you greatest streangths/weaknesses?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: HR  interview. Based on the work experience and General questions.Good communication skills will be preferred.Applying in Person will make it easy for selection process. Generally assistantships are offered to candidates with a good Undergraduate GPA or high communication and willingness to learn and help students.
Interview Questions: Why Master's? what was your role in previous work experience.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: upload the resume online, phone interview, onsite at NIU. Some behavior questions and the understanding on my major, some questions about my past projects. tell what I need to do in the future, ask whether I could handle it and how
Interview Questions: What program have you done in this field

title: Residence Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I interview first at TPE and then followed up with an On Campus interview that was a night and day long. The on campus interivew consisted of at like five specific interview with students, Grads, Full Time, Management team, and campus partners. All interviews where similar but had their own questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had a conflict with a colleague and how you handled it.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Primarily depended on academic success and history.  No prior teaching experience was necessary, but experience in communication or communication related activities was appreciated.  There was not as much emphasis on interviewing well, but rather, an overview to the position and discussion about balance between school and the position.
Interview Questions: Do you feel comfortable teaching public speaking?

title: Community Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Rotating interviews, lasted about 2-3 hours. It was conducted in Stevenson by current Community Advisors and Hall Directors. They also had a group interview part where they had about 8 candidates sit in a room together and work a situation out while a hall director sat in and listened.
Interview Questions: Name a time you stood up for what you believe in

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Meet the dean of the dept. , tell them about your work, meet the professor you want to work with, study his research, he will ask what have you done and how will he benefit from you working on this project.
Interview Questions: mostly the technical would be the questions on the project you will be working on.

title: Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with Supervisor and Manager to discuss job responsibilities and my qualifications. Very laid back but effective. I was informally offered the job but then HR took forever to complete the process, and eventually informed me that they had used the wrong background check form and I had to come in to sign a new form.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work at NIU.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Faculty member calls you and follows structured interview. They discuss your aspirations. This is all after you've passed the other hurdles (like GRE, GPA, and letters of rec being deemed acceptable).
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in research?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: it took almost 5 weeks to have the response from HR, and it will take another 3-4 weeks to get hiring process after the interview. In my option, the process is slow, maybe it is due to the nature of the public school
Interview Questions: some problems about the work/life balance, the most focused is the IT part.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: They usually take you cased upon your GRE
Interview Questions: Sometimes they test you on subjects that you are most comfortable in.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was given a chance to interview, through a friend who was already working in the current position. I would have been difficult if not, to be even apply for the position. Dressing appropriately and being on time is a key ingredient in every student worker interview process. They would ask you, if you are willing to stay more than two semesters in a row. Flexibility to working hours in also important in certain positions.
Interview Questions: Afraid of photocopy machines.. believe it or not? I was shocked, such a question came up in the interview.

title: Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very professional
Interview Questions: Are you able to handle this type of work?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: You have to show interest in the field for which the professor works. You have to stay updated with the latest software and strong basics is a must. Some professors are willing to take students who are interested in learning new skills.
Interview Questions: The position was for one course and I was also asked questions from other courses as well as he wanted to know if I had basic knowledge overall.

title: Huskies Den Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: I met with the head of the huskies den and we simply talked about what the requirements were for the job.  Went over my job history and saw if I had any previous experience working with students.  It was explained that I would be taught a lot on the job.
Interview Questions: What is your availability?

title: Community Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was very long.  3 hour non-stop interview. It consisted of a 1:1 a 2:1 and a group interview.  They will let you know within the second semester (if you applied for it the first semester) if you get an offer or not.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are suited for the job?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the university about the potential job and I was told to submit my application to the HR office.  I was then told that I needed to test for civil service.  After that I was one of the top three applicants, so myself and two others had separate interviews.  I was then contacted within a week that I was being offered the position and that I needed to fill out more paperwork with HR and then I had to wait over a week for HR to process everything.  I then started working once a new pay schedule started.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: applied for civil service exam, finished in top 3 and interviewd within a month. it took a couple months for the offer to come. very long process.
Interview Questions: describe a situation where one of your employees gave you problems.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions:
1. If you had an angry employee, how would you respond?
A: I would check to see if everything was alright. If the problem continued, then disciplinary actions would take into effect, if any. 

2. What is your definition of a leader?
A leader sets positive examples. They also abide in multiple responsibilities. A supervisor builds success within the company.
Interview Questions: 1. If you had an angry employee, how would you respond?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was initially contacted through email to set up a phone interview. Once interviewed by one faculty member, I was contacted by another to set up an additional phone interview. The interviews consisted of asking questions regarding my interests in various area of research. After a few weeks, I was again contacted by a faculty member notifying me that I was going to be offered the position. I was then sent materials from the university to fill out and return.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question I was asked concerned my particular interest in a line of research. This interview process was intended to determine the level of fit I had with a given faculty member's current interests.

title: ITS Inventory Clerk/Office Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Standard review with basic technical request questions including familiarity with Windows, Java, Office and other commonly used products.  I was able to demonstrate my knowledge though both description and demonstration.

Beyond that, they had me take sample support calls and monitored how I responded and how well I could explain the requisite steps for them to fix their issue.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with Windows, Office and similar products?

title: Web Application Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Asked questions regarding knowledge of programming languages. Specifically PHP and any past experience I had developing in that language.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between include and require.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northern Illinois University (DeKalb, IL) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Applied in person at HR. Took 3 months
Interview Questions: Easy, basic questions
